 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹּה‎</span><sub>58</sub>, and (<ref ref="Ezek 40:1-41:200" b="26" cBegin="40" vBegin="1" cEnd="41" vEnd="200" onclick="bcv(26,40,1)">Ezek 40:1-41:200</ref>, 23 out of 35 t.) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פּוֺ‎</span>, also [[Job.38.11|Job 38:11]]b <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹּא‎</span>, **adverb of location** ==here, hither== (probably from the same demonstrative √ found in <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***so, then*** (often in apodosis), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַף‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵפוֺא‎</span>: compare [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. l, 247 f., 243, 331 f.</sup>): — 

**1.** ***here:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [[Gen.19.12|Gen 19:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֹד מִילְֿךָ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹּה‎</span> whom hast thou still ***here ?*** [[Gen.22.5|Gen 22:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁבוּ לָכֶם פֹּה‎</span>, [[Gen.40.15|Gen 40:15]]; [[Num.22.8|Num 22:8]]; [[Num.32.16|Num 32:16]]; [[Deut.5.28|Deut 5:28]]; [[Deut.12.8|Deut 12:8]]; [[Judg.4.20|Judg 4:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲיֵשׁ פֹּה אִישׁ‎</span>, [[2Kgs.3.11|2Kgs 3:11]], etc.; asked in some surprise, [[Judg.18.3|Judg 18:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלְּֿךָ פֹה‎</span> = what is thy business ***here ?*** simil. [[1Kgs.19.9|1Kgs 19:9]]; [[1Kgs.19.13|1Kgs 19:13]]; [[Isa.22.16|Isa 22:16]]; [[Isa.52.5|Isa 52:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְעַתָּה מַהלִּֿיפֹֿה‎</span>. compare the synonym <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּזֶה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֹּה‎</span> 

**2. b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדפֹּֿה‎</span> [[Job.38.11|Job 38:11]] a. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפֹּה‎</span> or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפּוֺ‎</span>, only Ezek 40-41, and always (except [[Ezek.40.12|Ezek 40:12]] a, where it must be supplied with [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]]) repeated, ***on this side ... on that side*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִזֶּה ֗֗֗ מִזֶּה‎</span>), [[Ezek.40.10|Ezek 40:10]] (twice in verse); [[Ezek.40.12|Ezek 40:12]]b; [[Ezek.40.21|Ezek 40:21]] (twice in verse), etc. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** with the interrogative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵיפֹה‎</span> ***where ?***. 

**2.** after a verb of motion, ***hither***, [[1Sam.16.11|1Sam 16:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדבּֿאֹוֺ פֹה‎</span>, [[Ezra.4.2|Ezra 4:2]].
